useCase.name: List Research Groups
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to listing the research groups.
useCase.setup: The user is on the start page.

step.response: The system lists all the research groups registered.

useCase.name: Create Research Group
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to creating the research groups.

step.response: Displays the research group creation screen.

step.action: Fill the group info fields, filter the members by research group, select the members and click on the save button.
step.condition: The user is on the research group creation screen.
step.response: Creates the group and displays the created group detail screen.

flow.description: The user tries to create a Research Group with invalid data.

step.action: Input invalid data and click Save.
step.condition: The user is on the research group creation screen.
step.response: Displays an error message informing the fields that are invalid.

useCase.name: Detail Research Group
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to view a research group info.
useCase.setup: The user must have registered the research group previously

flow.description: View the info of a research group.

step.condition: The user is viewing the research group list.
step.response: Displays the research group detail screen.

useCase.name: Edit Research Group
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to editing a research group.
useCase.setup: The user must have registered the research group previously

step.condition: The user is viewing the research group detail.
step.response: Displays the research group edit screen.

step.action: Change the group info fields and click on the update button.
step.condition: The user is on the research group edit screen.
step.response: Updates the group and displays the created group detail screen.

flow.description: The user tries to save a group with invalid data.

step.action: Input invalid data and click Save.
step.condition: The user is on the research group edit screen.
step.response: Displays an error message informing the fields that are invalid.

useCase.name: Remove Research Group
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to removing a research group.
useCase.setup: The user must have registered the research group previously

step.condition: The user is viewing the research group detail.
The user is viewing the confirmation popup.
step.response: Removes the group and displays the research group list screen.

useCase.name: Research result inference
useCase.description: This use case describes the common behavior related to research group display the Research results of a group.
useCase.setup: The user must have researches related to the research group.

flow.description: Displays the researches related to a research group.

step.condition: The user is viewing the research group detail.
step.response: The system automatically searches and displays the researches on the research group detail screen.

useCase.name: List research lines
useCase.description: This use case describes the activities related to the listing of research lines.

step.response: The system displays a list of all the research lines registered in the system.

useCase.name: Show research line
useCase.description: This use case describes the activities related to the show information about a research line.

step.response: The system displays the data of the selected research line.

useCase.name: Create a research line
useCase.description: This use case describes the activities related to the creation of research line.

step.response: The system displays a form to fill out the new research line data.

step.action: Fill out the research line data, selecting its publications, and then, press on Create button.
step.response: The system validates the data and displays a success message.

useCase.name: Edit a research line
useCase.description: This use case describes the activities related to the edition of research line.

step.response: The system displays a form to update the research line data.

step.action: Edit the fields and then press the Update button
step.response: The system shows a message of success.

useCase.name: Remove a research line
useCase.description: In the research line removal the user can remove a research line, thus the relation with its publication must be undo.

step.response: The system displays a message of success.
The system show an additional field, where the user can set the research group father.
